VLIB_histogram_equal_8

Detailed Description


Functions

void VLIB_histogram_equal_8 (const uint8_t image[], int32_t n, int16_t t_hist[], uint8_t histeq_image[])

Function Documentation

void VLIB_histogram_equal_8 ( const uint8_t  image[],
int32_t  n,
int16_t  t_hist[],
uint8_t  histeq_image[] 
)

Description
This function uses histogram equalization to redistribute the intensity values of an image to span the full dynamic range (0-255) of an 8-bit per pixel image. Intermediate computation uses fixed point integer math (UQ24.8).
Parameters:
[in] image[] 8-bit input image array to one of the image channels (UQ8.0)
[in] n Number of pixels in the input image (< 262144) (SQ31.0)
[in] t_hist[] Array of scratch buffer to calculate the histogram (SQ15.0)
[out] histeq_image[] 8-bit output image array (UQ8.0)
Assumptions
  • All array buffers must be 8-byte aligned.
  • n must be a multiple of 8, and should be less than 262144
  • t_hist[] size should be 1024*sizeof(int16_t) = 2048 bytes
  • t_hist[] should be initialised to all zeros.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
